thread.title: Blue Hair, Green Hair, Pink Hair: It’s a Tween Thing
thread.title_full: Blue Hair, Green Hair, Pink Hair: It’s a Tween Thing - WSJ

author: Anne Marie Chaker
title: Blue Hair, Green Hair, Pink Hair: It’s a Tween Thing
text:
Laura DeFrate’s 10-year-old daughter Allison and 7-year-old son Indiana aren't allowed to have soda, get one hour of screen time a day, and have to be in bed by 8:30 p.m. Hair in colors like Shocking Blue, Plum Passion and Green Envy? “I let them,” she says.
Starting around age 8, tweens are finding creative ways to sport the candy-colored hues, whether the look is “dipped,” meaning only the ends are colored (making it easy to later chop off), or sneaking in a few strands that show only when the hair is clipped up.... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
